labels.analysis: The MCP Server for Railway is primarily focused on managing cloud infrastructure and services through a natural language interface. Its core functionality includes deploying, configuring, and monitoring services on the Railway platform. Key features revolve around service management, deployment control, environment configuration, and domain/DNS management. The tools enable users to automate infrastructure tasks that would typically require direct interaction with cloud platform APIs, making service management more accessible.
labels.reasoning: The primary label reflects the server's infrastructure as a service (IaaS) capabilities and its focus on service deployment and management in cloud environment. Secondary labels account for the development-related operations (Deployment Tools) and the configuration management aspects (Configuration Management) of the server's functionality. These labels most accurately represent the tools' capabilities and the primary use cases for this MCP server.

server_info_crawled.name: Railway MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @jason-tan-swe/railway-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your Railway infrastructure effortlessly using natural language. Deploy, configure, and monitor your services autonomously and securely with the help of Claude and other MCP clients.

tools.name: database_list_types
tools.description: Deploy Server Railway MCP Server @jason-tan-swe/railway-mcp Try in Playground database_list_types

tools.name: deployment_list
tools.description: [API] List recent deployments for a service in a specific environment ⚡️ Best for: ✓ Viewing deployment history ✓ Monitoring service updates → Prerequisites: service_list → Next steps: deployment_logs, deployment_trigger → Related: service_info, service_restart

tools.name: deployment_trigger
tools.description: ⚠️ Not for: × Updating environment variables (use variable_set) × Restarting services (use service_restart) × Triggering new deployments (use deployment_trigger)

tools.name: deployment_logs
tools.description:
[API] Get logs for a specific deployment

⚡️ Best for:
  ✓ Debugging deployment issues
  ✓ Monitoring deployment progress
  ✓ Checking build output

⚠️ Not for:
  × Service runtime logs
  × Database logs

→ Prerequisites: deployment_list

→ Next steps: deployment_status

→ Related: service_info, deployment_trigger

tools.name: deployment_status
tools.description:
[API] Check the current status of a deployment

⚡️ Best for:
  ✓ Monitoring deployment progress
  ✓ Verifying successful deployments
  ✓ Checking for deployment failures

⚠️ Not for:
  × Service runtime logs
  × Database logs

→ Prerequisites: deployment_list, deployment_trigger

→ Next steps: deployment_logs

→ Related: service_info, service_restart, deployment_wait

tools.name: domain_list
tools.description: [API] List all domains (both service and custom) for a service ⚡️ Best for: ✓ Viewing service endpoints ✓ Managing domain configurations ✓ Auditing domain settings → Prerequisites: service_list → Next steps: domain_create, domain_update → Related: service_info, tcp_proxy_list

tools.name: domain_create
tools.description:
[API] Create a new domain for a service

⚡️ Best for:
  ✓ Setting up custom domains
  ✓ Configuring service endpoints
  ✓ Adding HTTPS endpoints

⚠️ Not for:
  × TCP proxy setup (use tcp_proxy_create)
  × Internal service communication

→ Prerequisites: service_list, domain_check

→ Alternatives: tcp_proxy_create

→ Next steps: domain_update

→ Related: service_info, domain_list

tools.name: domain_check
tools.description:
[API] Check if a domain is available for use

⚡️ Best for:
  ✓ Validating domain availability
  ✓ Pre-deployment checks
  ✓ Domain planning

→ Next steps: domain_create

→ Related: domain_list

tools.name: domain_update
tools.description:
[API] Update a domain's configuration

⚡️ Best for:
  ✓ Changing target ports
  ✓ Updating domain settings
  ✓ Reconfiguring endpoints

⚠️ Not for:
  × Changing domain names (delete and recreate instead)
  × TCP proxy configuration

→ Prerequisites: domain_list

→ Next steps: domain_list

→ Related: service_update

tools.name: domain_delete
tools.description: [API] Delete a domain from a service ⚡️ Best for: ✓ Removing unused domains ✓ Cleaning up configurations ✓ Domain management ⚠️ Not for: × Temporary domain disabling × Port updates (use domain_update) → Prerequisites: domain_list → Alternatives: domain_update → Related: service_update

tools.name: project_list
tools.description: [API] List all projects in your Railway account ⚡️ Best for: ✓ Getting an overview of all projects ✓ Finding project IDs ✓ Project discovery and management → Next steps: project_info, service_list → Related: project_create, project_delete

tools.description: ⚠️ Not for: × Restarting services (use service_restart) × Updating service config (use service_update) × Database changes

tools.description: [UTILITY] Configure the Railway API token for authentication (only needed if not set in environment variables) ⚡️ Best for: ✓ Initial setup ✓ Token updates ✓ Authentication configuration ⚠️ Not for: × Project configuration × Service settings × Environment variables → Next steps: project_list, service_list → Related: project_create

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jason-tan-swe/railway-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: railwayApiToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Railway API token for authentication. If not provided here, ensure it's available in the environment.
